events.description: The LeetCode Session hosted by the Computer Science Society is a dynamic and interactive session for individuals to enhance their coding skills and prepare for a successful career in the field of computer science. RSVP: https://kzoocss.org/LC

events.title: Fun Game Night #8
events.description: Join the Computer Science Society for a night of friendly competition and camaraderie as we play a selection of board games. Enjoy delicious food while getting to know your fellow members. Don't miss out on this fun-filled event! RSVP: https://kzoocss.org/fun

events.title: Leetcode Session #9
events.description: The CSS LeetCode Session is a weekly gathering of driven computer science students looking to level up their coding skills and get ready for job interviews. Every Thursday, the group convenes in OU312 to tackle challenging LeetCode problems and improve their coding abilities. RSVP: https://kzoocss.org/LC

events.title: Socialization Event
events.description: The Computer Science Society is inviting everyone to an informal gathering where attendees can chat with the leadership team and other members of the computer science community. This is a great opportunity to ask questions, gain new perspectives, and make connections with like-minded individuals. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, come along and share your thoughts and ideas in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Get ready to have some fun and network with your computer science peers! RSVP: https://kzoocss.org/MAJOR

events.title: Leetcode Session #8
events.description: Join the Computer Science Society on Thursday in OU312 for our CSS LeetCode Session, where ambitious computer science students gather to improve their coding skills and prepare for job interviews. Come sharpen your skills and learn from your peers in a supportive and collaborative environment! RSVP: https://forms.gle/vML11sGB7wugQmnt5

events.title: Leetcode Session #7
events.description: A typical Thursday event, CSS LeetCode Session, where a group of ambitious computer science students gathered to sharpen their coding skills and prepare for upcoming job interviews. Join us in OU316! RSVP: https://forms.gle/95UbufLAM8Z8PcvQA

events.title: Guest Talk: Revaz Bakuradze
events.description: Revaz, K college alumni and current software engineer at Amazon, utilizes his skills developed at Kalamazoo College to create user-friendly digital solutions for a wide range of personal and business problems. Join the talk and learn insight on how to leverage your college education to succeed in the tech industry! Food is provided! RSVP: https://forms.gle/heYJRBCWMvNvy3fx7

events.title: Leetcode Session #6
events.description: The Computer Science Society is excited to host a Leetcode session for all members interested in sharpening their coding skills and preparing for technical interviews. Join us on Thursday!

events.title: Fun Game Night #7
events.description: The Computer Science Society invites you to a fun night of board games and socializing. Come join us as we play a variety of games and get to know your fellow members. Food is provided! RSVP: https://forms.gle/YMcWHFiDvNLPvcLg7

events.title: Leetcode Session #5
events.description: This is our FINAL Leetcode session of the term!  Come and join us to enhance your skills in LeetCode, share good resources, and learn from your peers! Earlier you start, the more progress you make!

events.title: Fun Game Night #6
events.description: Join our FINAL game night of the trimester! We will be playing a variety of cooperative and competitive board games, so come ready to have a good time! Food is provided, but please RSVP through the signup form in the email to let us know if you are coming.

events.title: Leetcode Session #4
events.description: Our fourth Leetcode session. Yet we are not limited to Leetcode problems. Come to join us, and discuss any coding challenges you may face. And of course, practice with your peers!

events.title: Guest Talk: Mai Phuong Vu
events.description: Mai is a Vietnamese-Hungarian UX Designer at a small startup called PeachPay. She graduated from a small liberal arts college, Grinnell College, in May 2021 with a B.A. in Computer Science and Psychology. In her first 3 years of college she thought she would become a software engineer, specifically a frontend engineer as she enjoyed working on the UI. However, in the end of her 3rd year she found out about UX Design and Product Management, and started to explore these new field through volunteering at Develop for Good and Bridging Tech. She found her love in solving user problems rather than algorithm and efficiency problems, and so she switched to UX Design. In the past few years she has been especially interested in the connection between design and development and in ways to improve this link.

events.title: Leetcode Session #3
events.description: Our third Leetcode session. Do you need help with technical interview preparation? Join the Computer Science Society's Session to practice with your peers! New questions and the solutions to the previous problems are posted here every Monday. We will go through all of them in person in OU312 on Thursday at 4:00pm.

events.title: Fun Game Night #5
events.description: We will have our fun game night at 7pm at Olds Upton 316. This will be our SECOND LAST fun event for this term! Bring your favorite board game to play together and make new friends!

events.title: Career Event #2

events.title: Leetcode Session #1
events.description: Come to our first leetcode session of the term! We will show you tips and tricks to nail leetcode. You will have a chance to practice your coding knowledge, solve leetcode problems, and get ready for technical interviews!

events.title: Fun Game Night
events.description: Bring your favorite boardgame to play together and make new friends while enjoying pizza!

events.title: Career Event #1
events.description: Join us for our first career event for students looking for jobs in the tech industry! We will show you what the job/internship application process looks like and provide you with resources to help you stand out. You will discover new tech-related communities and learn more about the various CS jobs available! FULL DINNER IS PROVIDED! The event will be held on Wednesday (October 5) at 5 pm in OU316.

events.title: K Fest!!!
events.description: Welcome to K Fest 2022! We're so excited to have you join us as we have over 60 departments and organizations excited to meet you!

events.title: It's MORE than Just Coding
events.description: [FREE FOOD] Come and talk to fellow students about your interests & how Computer Science Society can provide opportunities to make your college journey more enjoyable. Our events can include networking, games, projects, resume building, and getting to know your peers! You decide what we bring to campus.
